marketNews.title: KPK investigates Bank Indonesia over alleged CSR fund misuse
marketNews.content: CNN Indonesia reported that the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) on Monday night (16/12) raided the office of Bank Indonesia, including the Governor Perry Warjiyo's workspace, in connection with alleged corruption involving the bank's corporate social responsibility (CSR) funds. Previously, in September 2024, the KPK uncovered allegations of misuse of Bank Indonesia's CSR funds for personal purposes. The raid occurred one day before the Board of Governors meeting scheduled for 17-18 December 2024.

marketNews.title: World Bank maintains Indonesia growth outlook at 5% for 2024-2026
marketNews.content: The World Bank kept its outlook for Indonesia's economic growth at +5% for 2024 and +5.1% for 2025 and 2026. However, the Bank projects the economy will slow to +5% in 2027, which is far below President Prabowo Subianto's target of +8% growth within three years after taking office.

marketNews.title: China plans 2025 growth target of around 5% and budget deficit of 4% of GDP
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that the Chinese government plans to set an economic growth target of around +5% for 2025 (same as the 2024 target), with the fiscal deficit rising from 3% to 4% of GDP. The report appeared a few days after Chinese leaders, including President Xi Jinping, concluded the annual economic conference in Beijing, where they are believed to have set the 2025 target. The official announcement is expected in the parliamentary session in March 2025. Bloomberg also reported that the two targets are largely in line with economists' expectations.

marketNews.title: Pan Brothers (PBRX) close to $537 million debt restructuring
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Pan Brothers (ticker PBRX) is close to completing a debt restructuring worth $537 million after seven months of negotiations with creditors. PBRX will seek creditor approval on Wednesday (18/12), which would prevent the company from bankruptcy. Bloomberg sources said major creditors, including SC Lowy, have verbally supported the restructuring plan. Pan Brothers is one of Indonesia's largest textile companies, employing about 27,000 workers.

tickerNews.title: RATU and its parent RAJA announce IPO with market cap 2.4-3.1 trillion IDR
tickerNews.content: The subsidiary of Rukun Raharja (ticker RAJA), Raharja Energi Cepu (ticker RATU), announced a plan to conduct an IPO offering 543.01 million shares (20% of the company), consisting of 190 million new shares (7%) and 352.9 million shares (13%) divested from RAJA ownership. The price range is 900-1,150 IDR per share, implying a market capitalization of approximately 2.4-3.1 trillion IDR. Total proceeds from the IPO are estimated at 488.7-624.5 billion IDR, of which about 171-218.6 billion IDR will go to RATU's cash and about 317.7-405.9 billion IDR to RAJA's cash. RATU is a holding company investing as a non-operator in two Indonesian oil and gas exploration blocks: Cepu Block (â‰ˆ2.2% participation) and Jabung Block (8% participation). In the first half of 2024, Cepu Block produced 144 thousand barrels of oil per day, about 25% of the national oil lifting, while Jabung Block produced 52 thousand barrels of oil equivalent per day, about 3.5% of national oil and gas lifting. After the IPO, the shareholder structure of RATU will be RAJA (~80%), PT Rukun Prima Sarana (0.004%), and the public (20%). All IPO funds will be allocated to working capital: approximately 157.36 billion IDR will be loaned to PT Raharja Energi Tanjung Jabung to pay a cash call from PetroChina International Jabung Ltd. for Jabung Block management; about 34.97 billion IDR will be loaned to PT Petrogas Jatim Utama Cendana to pay a cash call from ExxonMobil Cepu Ltd. for Cepu Block management; the remaining funds will be used for employee, director, commissioner remuneration and operational costs. RATU is offered at a valuation of about 6.0-7.6 times 1H24 TTM P/E, or annualized 10.3-13.2 times P/E, lower than RAJA's 22.9 times annualized 1H24 P/E at 2,670 IDR per share. Nevertheless, RATU's valuation is premium compared with peers Medco Energi Internasional (ticker MEDC) and Energi Mega Persada (ticker ENRG), which trade at 4.5 and 4.9 times 9M24 annualized P/E respectively. The analysis concludes that despite a higher valuation than peers, RATU appears justified to trade at a premium due to superior profitability as reflected in higher ROE and ROA.

tickerNews.title: ADRO declares interim dividend with indicated yield 4.2%
tickerNews.content: Alamtri Resources Indonesia (ticker ADRO) will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to 200 million US dollars or 105 IDR per share, assuming an exchange rate of 16,146 IDR per US dollar. The cum date is on the regular market and negotiation on 27 December 2024, with payment on 15 January 2025. Based on ADRO's closing price on Tuesday (17/12) at 2,510 IDR per share, the implied dividend yield is 4.2%.

tickerNews.title: SILO shares purchased by Sight Investment Company, increasing stake to 63.4%
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of Siloam International Hospitals, Sight Investment Company Pte. Ltd., bought 1.05 billion SILO shares from Prime Health Company Limited at an average price of 2,850 IDR per share on 11 December 2024. The total transaction value is approximately 3 trillion IDR. After the transaction, Sight Investment Company's ownership in SILO rose from 55.4% to 63.4%, while Prime Health Company Limited's ownership fell from 8.04% to zero.

tickerNews.title: PTRO approves 1-for-10 stock split
tickerNews.content: Petrosea shareholders on Monday (16/12) approved a stock split with a ratio of 1:10. According to prior information disclosure, the new nominal value trading will occur on the regular market and negotiation on 30 December 2024.

tickerNews.title: ACES reports store closures and openings, total 245 stores
tickerNews.content: The Head of Corporate Communications of Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia, Melinda Pudjo, said the company closed 7 stores since early 2024, while opening 19 new stores. The total new stores exceed the 2024 target of 15 new stores, indicating that ACES now operates 245 stores (vs. 233 in 2023). Pudjo mentioned that the 2025 expansion plan will be designed to continue the growth momentum of 2024, though she did not specify the number of new stores or capex allocation for the next year.

tickerNews.title: INTP cement sales volume up 3.7% YoY in November 2024
tickerNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa (ticker INTP) recorded a 3.7% year-on-year increase in cement sales volume (including Semen Grobogan) in November 2024, with market share rising to 29.5% (vs. 27.3% in November 2023) as industry-wide sales fell 4% YoY. The growth was driven by Java Island (+7.2% YoY), with Central Java alone up 49% YoY due to consolidation of Semen Grobogan. Over the 11 months of 2024, INTP's cement sales volume grew 9% YoY to 17.3 million tonnes.

tickerNews.title: LINK targets 1-1.5 million additional homepasses by 2025
tickerNews.content: Link Net (ticker LINK) director Kanishka Gayan Wickrama said the company aims to add about 1-1.5 million homepasses in 2025. LINK is finalizing its business plan, so detailed performance targets and 2025 capex allocation have not yet been disclosed. During the first nine months of 2024, LINK added 482,000 homepass connections, reaching a total of 4.03 million.

tickerNews.title: RDTX declares interim dividend with yield 1%
tickerNews.content: Roda Vivatex (ticker RDTX) will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to approximately 40.6 billion IDR or 151 IDR per share. The cum date is on the regular market and negotiation on 27 December 2024, with payment on 15 January 2025. Based on RDTX's closing price on Tuesday (17/12) at 15,000 IDR per share, the implied dividend yield is 1%.

tickerNews.title: AMAR declares interim dividend with yield 0.7%
tickerNews.content: Bank Amar Indonesia (ticker AMAR) will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to approximately 25.2 billion IDR or 1.4 IDR per share. The cum date is on the regular market and negotiation on 24 December 2024, with payment on 15 January 2025. Based on AMAR's closing price on Tuesday (17/12) at 199 IDR per share, the implied dividend yield is 0.7%.

tickerNews.title: PZZA stake increase by Pemberton Asian Opportunities Fund
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Sarimelati Kencana (ticker PZZA), Pemberton Asian Opportunities Fund, bought 40 million PZZA shares at 128 IDR per share on 12 December 2024. The total transaction value is about 5.1 billion IDR. After the transaction, Pemberton Asian Opportunities Fund's ownership in PZZA rose from 4.96% to 6.29%.

tickerNews.title: FITT shares sold by Jon Fieris, reducing stake to 9.35%
tickerNews.content: Hotel Fitra International (ticker FITT) shareholder Jon Fieris sold 70 million FITT shares at an average price of 96 IDR per share on 12-13 December 2024. The total transaction value is about 6.7 billion IDR. After the transaction, Jon Fieris's ownership in FITT decreased from 14.72% to 9.35%.

tickerNews.title: PBRX close to $537 million debt restructuring
tickerNews.content: Pan Brothers (ticker PBRX) is nearing the completion of a $537 million debt restructuring after seven months of negotiations with creditors. The company will seek creditor approval on Wednesday (18/12), which would prevent bankruptcy. Bloomberg sources indicated that major creditors, including SC Lowy, have verbally supported the restructuring plan. Pan Brothers is one of Indonesia's largest textile firms, employing roughly 27,000 workers.
